hypostatise.gloss: construe as a real existence, of a conceptual entity

hypostatize.gloss: construe as a real existence, of a conceptual entity

hypothecate.gloss: to believe especially on uncertain or tentative grounds

hypothesise.gloss: to believe especially on uncertain or tentative grounds

hypothesize.gloss: to believe especially on uncertain or tentative grounds

hydrated.gloss: containing combined water (especially water of crystallization as in a hydrate)

hydrographic.gloss: of or relating to the science of hydrography

hydrographical.gloss: of or relating to the science of hydrography

hydrous.gloss: containing combined water (especially water of crystallization as in a hydrate)

hygienic.gloss: tending to promote or preserve health

hygienical.gloss: tending to promote or preserve health

hypaethral.gloss: partly or entirely open to the sky

hypermetropic.gloss: abnormal ability to focus of distant objects

hyperopic.gloss: abnormal ability to focus of distant objects

hypersensitised.gloss: having an allergy or peculiar or excessive susceptibility (especially to a specific factor)

hypersensitive.gloss: having an allergy or peculiar or excessive susceptibility (especially to a specific factor)

hypersensitized.gloss: having an allergy or peculiar or excessive susceptibility (especially to a specific factor)

hypertrophied.gloss: (of an organ or body part) excessively enlarged as a result of increased size in the constituent cells

hypethral.gloss: partly or entirely open to the sky

hypnotised.gloss: having your attention fixated as though by a spell

hypnotized.gloss: having your attention fixated as though by a spell

hypophyseal.gloss: of or relating to the hypophysis

hypophysectomised.gloss: having the pituitary gland removed by surgery

hypophysectomized.gloss: having the pituitary gland removed by surgery

hypophysial.gloss: of or relating to the hypophysis

hypothetic.gloss: based primarily on surmise rather than adequate evidence

hypothetical.gloss: based primarily on surmise rather than adequate evidence

hypovolaemic.gloss: of or relating to a decrease in the volume of circulating blood

hypovolemic.gloss: of or relating to a decrease in the volume of circulating blood

hysteric.gloss: characterized by or arising from psychoneurotic hysteria

hysterical.gloss: characterized by or arising from psychoneurotic hysteria
